column2: The time-to-expiry target for options selection
The mean of the MPD;  mu = sum(probability at ln-return x * ln-return x)
The standard deviation of the MPD;  sd = sqrt(sum(probability at ln-return x * (ln-return x - mu)^2))
The skew of the MPD;  skew = sum(probability at ln-return x * (ln-return x - mu)^3)/(sd^3)
The kurtosis of the MPD;  kurt = sum(probability at ln-return x * (ln-return x - mu)^4)/(sd^4)-3
The change in the expected return in percentage terms defined as "large"
The probability of a "large decline" in return as defined by "lg_change_prob"
The probability of a "large increase" in return as defined by "lg_change_prob"
